question: At the beginning of the meeting, there were 40 doctors and 11 nurses. After 45 minutes, 1/3 of the total number of people left. How many nurses are left if 17 doctors stayed at the meeting?
answer:
There were a total of 40 doctors + 11 nurses = <<40+11=51>>51 people who attended the meeting.
After 45 minutes, 51 people * 1/3 = <<51*1/3=17>>17 people left the meeting.
This means 51 people - 17 people = <<51-17=34>>34 people stayed.
Out of the 34 who stayed, 34 people - 17 doctors = <<34-17=17>>17 were nurses.
#### 17
